verses.verse: Urgent Prayer for the Restored Favor of God To the Chief Musician. (Ps. 80) Set to “Lily of the Testimony.” A Michtam of David. For teaching. (2 Sam. 8:3, 13; 1 Chr. 18:3) When he fought against Mesopotamia and Syria of Zobah, and Joab returned and killed twelve thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt. [1] O God, (Ps. 44:9) You have cast us off; You have broken us down; You have been displeased; Oh, restore us again!
You have made the earth tremble; You have broken it; ((2 Chr. 7:14); Is. 30:26) Heal its breaches, for it is shaking.
(Ps. 71:20) You have shown Your people hard things; (Is. 51:17, 22; Jer. 25:15) You have made us drink the wine of confusion.
(Ps. 20:5; Is. 5:26; 11:12; 13:2) You have given a banner to those who fear You, That it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah
(Ps. 108:6-13) That Your beloved may be delivered, Save with Your right hand, and hear me.
God has (Ps. 89:35) spoken in His holiness: “I will rejoice; I will (Josh. 1:6) divide (Gen. 12:6) Shechem And measure out (Josh. 13:27) the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; (Deut. 33:17) Ephraim also is the helmet for My head; ((Gen. 49:10)) Judah is My lawgiver.
(2 Sam. 8:2) Moab is My washpot; (2 Sam. 8:14; Ps. 108:9) Over Edom I will cast My shoe; (2 Sam. 8:1) Philistia, shout in triumph because of Me.”
Who will bring me to the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?
Is it not You, O God, (Ps. 108:11) who cast us off? And You, O God, who did (Josh. 7:12) not go out with our armies?
Give us help from trouble, (Ps. 118:8; 146:3) For the help of man is useless.
Through God (Num. 24:18) we will do valiantly, For it is He who shall tread down our enemies.
